intro: Cristaria patagonica, commonly known as the Patagonian starwort, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It features slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Cristaria patagonica is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
